result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Defense requested Plea hearing. Court ordered cases adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains in calendared in Branch 45.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Bughman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; out ill. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered no contact with NDS and her family, 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lawrence D Lejon-Jurnett in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
